overview_of_class:
COURSE DESCRIPTION / Processes controlling transport and fate of dissolved
and suspended substances in natural and engineered environmental systems. Mass balances, hydrodynamic transport, phase and mass transfers; the fate of
reactive species in complex environmental systems.
name: Environmental Transport Processes
title: MEAS CIV_ENV 440-0-01 Environmental Transport Processes

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value:
COURSE DESCRIPTION / Processes controlling transport and fate of dissolved
and suspended substances in natural and engineered environmental systems. Mass balances, hydrodynamic transport, phase and mass transfers; the fate of
reactive species in complex environmental systems.

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value: Graduate-level students or permission of the instructor. Differential equations and linear algebra.

descriptions.name: Teaching Method
descriptions.value: CLASS SCHEDULE / Two 1 and 1/2 periods per week. Lab Section Required. Lab Scheduling to be arranged with instructor and class.

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: BASIS OF GRADE / ***Final Exam / ***Midterm / ***Paper (literature review) A particular emphasis is placed on the breadth and depth of the literature review / ***Homework.

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value: Transport Modeling for Environmental Scientists and Engineers / Mark M. Clark / ISBN-13: 978-0-470-26072-2 / 2009 / 2nd / Wiley

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Suggested)
descriptions.value:
Recommended Reference Books:

1. Process Dynamics in Environmental Systems. Walter J. Weber & Francis A. DiGiano, Wiley, 1996.
2. Scientific journals relevant to the class in SEL.
3. Environmental Systems & Processes, Weber, 2001, Wiley. ISBN 0471405183
4. Mixing in Inland and Coastal Waters / Fischer, et al / ISBN-13: 978-0122581502 / 1979 / pbk / Academic Press
